Build ID: I20070608-1718

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Open eclipse
2. Create new Java project
3. Add class Application with a main, us nl.askesis as package
4. Let main print "Hello world"
5. Choose run or debug
6. Get an exception

I couldn't reproduce this. Has anyone else been able to?
Which version of AJDT do you have installed?
Is the exception actually connected to running the class? Does it happen every time you run the class? It looks like the exception is occurring when the AJDT UI plugin starts up.

Created an attachment (id=71622)
Log file

This my eclipse log file, created by:

1. Cleaning the log file
2. Restarting Eclipse
3. Importing a working application from 3.2 (created the same way as oroginal bug report program)
4. Run the application
5. Get the exception

Notice the startup exceptions, maybe they are related?

The exact AJDT version:

org.eclipse.ajdt (1.5.0.200706070619) "AspectJ Development Tools"
org.eclipse.ajdt.source (1.5.0.200706070619) "Eclipse AspectJ Development Tools Source Code"

I'm cc'ing cross-project.inbox as the logs show similar exceptions from other projects, including BIRT. And also to ask if anyone else can reproduce this - could the problem be specific to the x86_64 arch perhaps?

I have tested a new build of Eclipse. A clean Eclipse with a simple "Hello World" works OK but after installing my default plugins is stops working. 

A full list of my plugins/feaatures is in the attached file.
Moving over to cross-project to see if anyone else can help narrow this down
After installing the newest version of Eclipse and all my plugins on 26 June the problem does not appear anymore.
I guess the bug can be closed then if the problem is not present with the latest RC
